note_text:
Pt: Brown, Joseph || MRN: 213199 || DOB: 8/28/1953
Date: 11/03/2025 || Location: University Medical Center, Boston, MA
MD: Dr. O'Brien

DIAGNOSIS: Recurrent endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma with symptomatic RUL obstruction
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopy with placement of brachytherapy catheter (HDR Session 3/2)
PRIOR THERAPY: Prior EBRT (60 Gy completed 6 months ago)

INDICATION: 72 y/o male with Squamous cell carcinoma presenting with dyspnea, cough, hemoptysis. Endobronchial lesion at RUL bronchus with approximately 75% obstruction. Tumor length estimated at 2.5 cm. Patient evaluated by radiation oncology and deemed candidate for HDR endobronchial brachytherapy for palliation.

SEDATION: Moderate sedation
AIRWAY: Native

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Transnasal flexible bronchoscopy performed. Airway inspection revealed endobronchial tumor at RUL bronchus with significant luminal obstruction. Tumor appears infiltrative with moderate surface ulceration.

CATHETER PLACEMENT:
A 5F flexible catheter was introduced through the bronchoscope working channel. The catheter was advanced past the distal margin of the lesion to a position approximately 2 cm beyond the tumor. Catheter position verified under fluoroscopy. The catheter was marked at the nostril and secured with tape. Dummy source positioning performed. Treatment length: 4.5 cm (tumor + 1 cm margins).

TREATMENT PLAN:
HDR brachytherapy planned: 10.0 Gy x 2 fractions prescribed at 1.0 cm from catheter center.
Fractionation schedule: 2 weeks intervals.
Session 3 of 2 to be delivered today.

COMPLICATIONS: None. No bleeding. No catheter dislodgment.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient transported to Radiation Oncology for treatment delivery. Catheter to remain in place if next session within 24h. CXR obtained - no pneumothorax.

PLAN: 
- Final brachytherapy session completed
- Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks to assess response
- Continue symptom management
- Contact clinic for acute dyspnea, hemoptysis, or fever

O. O'Brien MD

registry_entry.primary_indication: Recurrent endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma with symptomatic RUL obstruction

evidence.institution_name: Location: University Medical Center, Boston, MA
evidence.primary_indication: DIAGNOSIS: Recurrent endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma with symptomatic RUL obstruction

follow_up_plan: Final brachytherapy session completed
Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks to assess response
registry_entry.prior_therapy: Prior EBRT (60 Gy completed 6 months ago)

code_rationales.31643: Bronchoscopy with placement of catheter for intracavitary radioelement application for HDR endobronchial brachytherapy at RUL bronchus. Catheter positioned to treat 2.5 cm tumor with margins.

notes: CPT 31643 is the primary code for bronchoscopy with brachytherapy catheter placement.
The radiation oncology service bills separately for treatment planning (77316-77318) and HDR delivery (77785-77787).
The pulmonologist/interventionalist bills only for the catheter placement procedure.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Codes align with documented endobronchial brachytherapy catheter placement procedure. CPT 31643 covers bronchoscopic catheter insertion for radioelement application.

radiation_oncology_codes.treatment_planning: 77316-77318 (brachytherapy isodose plan - billed by radiation oncology)
radiation_oncology_codes.hdr_delivery: 77785-77787 (HDR brachytherapy delivery - billed by radiation oncology)

billing_notes.coding_guidance: Per CMS LCD L30320: The pulmonologist should not report brachytherapy treatment codes. Only the catheter placement (31643) is reported by the bronchoscopist. The radioelement and treatment delivery are billed separately by radiation oncology.

changes: Generated synthetic brachytherapy procedure note with complete registry data

note_text:
Pt: Rodriguez, William || MRN: 268045 || DOB: 3/20/1962
Date: 11/06/2025 || Location: Memorial Hospital, Houston, TX
MD: Dr. Stevens

DIAGNOSIS: Symptomatic LMS endobronchial NSCLC causing stridor and dyspnea
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopy with placement of brachytherapy catheter (HDR Session 2/2)
PRIOR THERAPY: Chemotherapy with carboplatin/paclitaxel, EBRT contraindicated due to prior radiation

INDICATION: 63 y/o male with Adenocarcinoma presenting with stridor, severe dyspnea. Endobronchial lesion at LMS (left main stem) with approximately 60% obstruction. Tumor length estimated at 1.8 cm. Patient evaluated by radiation oncology and deemed candidate for HDR endobronchial brachytherapy for palliation.

SEDATION: Moderate sedation
AIRWAY: Native

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Transnasal flexible bronchoscopy performed. Airway inspection revealed endobronchial tumor at LMS (left main stem) with significant luminal obstruction. Tumor appears infiltrative with moderate surface ulceration.

CATHETER PLACEMENT:
A 6F afterloading catheter was introduced through the bronchoscope working channel. The catheter was advanced past the distal margin of the lesion to a position approximately 2 cm beyond the tumor. Catheter position verified under fluoroscopy. The catheter was marked at the nostril and secured with tape. Dummy source positioning performed. Treatment length: 3.8 cm (tumor + 1 cm margins).

TREATMENT PLAN:
HDR brachytherapy planned: 10.0 Gy x 2 fractions prescribed at 1.0 cm from catheter center.
Fractionation schedule: 2 weeks intervals.
Session 2 of 2 to be delivered today.

COMPLICATIONS: None. No bleeding. No catheter dislodgment.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient transported to Radiation Oncology for treatment delivery. Catheter removed post-treatment. CXR obtained - no pneumothorax.

PLAN: 
- Final brachytherapy session completed
- Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks to assess response
- Continue symptom management
- Contact clinic for acute dyspnea, hemoptysis, or fever

S. Stevens MD

Date: 11/09/2025 || Location: Regional Medical Center, Chicago, IL
MD: Dr. Washington

DIAGNOSIS: Malignant endobronchial lesion BI (bronchus intermedius) with post-obstructive pneumonia
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopy with placement of brachytherapy catheter (HDR Session 1/4)
PRIOR THERAPY: None - primary brachytherapy for palliation

INDICATION: 80 y/o female with NSCLC NOS presenting with pneumonia, fever, productive cough. Endobronchial lesion at Bronchus intermedius with approximately 80% obstruction. Tumor length estimated at 3.0 cm. Patient evaluated by radiation oncology and deemed candidate for HDR endobronchial brachytherapy for palliation.

SEDATION: General anesthesia
AIRWAY: ETT

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Transnasal flexible bronchoscopy performed. Airway inspection revealed endobronchial tumor at Bronchus intermedius with significant luminal obstruction. Tumor appears infiltrative with moderate surface ulceration.

CATHETER PLACEMENT:
A 6F afterloading catheter was introduced through the bronchoscope working channel. The catheter was advanced past the distal margin of the lesion to a position approximately 2 cm beyond the tumor. Catheter position verified under fluoroscopy. The catheter was marked at the nostril and secured with tape. Dummy source positioning performed. Treatment length: 5.0 cm (tumor + 1 cm margins).

TREATMENT PLAN:
HDR brachytherapy planned: 6.0 Gy x 4 fractions prescribed at 1.0 cm from catheter center.
Fractionation schedule: weekly intervals.
Session 1 of 4 to be delivered today.

COMPLICATIONS: None. No bleeding. No catheter dislodgment.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient transported to Radiation Oncology for treatment delivery. Catheter to remain in place if next session within 24h. CXR obtained - no pneumothorax.

PLAN: 
- Return for session 2/4 in weekly
- Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks to assess response
- Continue symptom management
- Contact clinic for acute dyspnea, hemoptysis, or fever

DIAGNOSIS: Recurrent carcinoid tumor RML causing recurrent hemoptysis
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopy with placement of brachytherapy catheter (HDR Session 1/3)

Bronchial washing performed for cytology.

CATHETER PLACEMENT:
A 5F flexible catheter was introduced through the bronchoscope working channel. The catheter was advanced past the distal margin of the lesion to a position approximately 2 cm beyond the tumor. Catheter position verified under fluoroscopy. The catheter was marked at the nostril and secured with tape. Dummy source positioning performed. Treatment length: 3.2 cm (tumor + 1 cm margins).

TREATMENT PLAN:
HDR brachytherapy planned: 5.0 Gy x 3 fractions prescribed at 1.0 cm from catheter center.
Fractionation schedule: weekly intervals.
Session 1 of 3 to be delivered today.

COMPLICATIONS: None. No bleeding. No catheter dislodgment.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient transported to Radiation Oncology for treatment delivery. Catheter to remain in place if next session within 24h. CXR obtained - no pneumothorax.

PLAN: 
- Return for session 2/3 in weekly
- Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks to assess response
- Continue symptom management
- Contact clinic for acute dyspnea, hemoptysis, or fever

note_text:
Pt: Martinez, Margaret || MRN: 217055 || DOB: 11/4/1971
Date: 11/25/2025 || Location: Mayo Clinic, Rochester, MN
MD: Dr. Kim

DIAGNOSIS: Central small cell lung cancer status post chemotherapy with endobronchial recurrence
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopy with placement of brachytherapy catheter (HDR Session 1/4)
PRIOR THERAPY: 4 cycles cisplatin/etoposide, prophylactic cranial irradiation

INDICATION: 54 y/o female with Small cell lung cancer presenting with cough, mild dyspnea. Endobronchial lesion at Main carina with approximately 40% obstruction. Tumor length estimated at 1.5 cm. Patient evaluated by radiation oncology and deemed candidate for HDR endobronchial brachytherapy for local control.

SEDATION: Moderate sedation
AIRWAY: Native

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Transnasal flexible bronchoscopy performed. Airway inspection revealed endobronchial tumor at Main carina with partial luminal obstruction. Tumor appears infiltrative with minimal surface ulceration.
Endobronchial biopsies obtained x3 from tumor margins for pathology confirmation.

CATHETER PLACEMENT:
A 6F afterloading catheter was introduced through the bronchoscope working channel. The catheter was advanced past the distal margin of the lesion to a position approximately 2 cm beyond the tumor. Catheter position verified under fluoroscopy. The catheter was marked at the nostril and secured with tape. Dummy source positioning performed. Treatment length: 3.5 cm (tumor + 1 cm margins).

TREATMENT PLAN:
HDR brachytherapy planned: 6.0 Gy x 4 fractions prescribed at 1.0 cm from catheter center.
Fractionation schedule: weekly intervals.
Session 1 of 4 to be delivered today.

COMPLICATIONS: None. No bleeding. No catheter dislodgment.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient transported to Radiation Oncology for treatment delivery. Catheter to remain in place if next session within 24h. CXR obtained - no pneumothorax.

PLAN: 
- Return for session 2/4 in weekly
- Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks to assess response
- Continue symptom management
- Contact clinic for acute dyspnea, hemoptysis, or fever

K. Kim MD

registry_entry.primary_indication: Central small cell lung cancer status post chemotherapy with endobronchial recurrence

evidence.primary_indication: DIAGNOSIS: Central small cell lung cancer status post chemotherapy with endobronchial recurrence

follow_up_plan: Return for session 2/4 in weekly
Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks to assess response

code_rationales.31643: Bronchoscopy with placement of catheter for intracavitary radioelement application for HDR endobronchial brachytherapy at Main carina. Catheter positioned to treat 1.5 cm tumor with margins.
code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsy performed to confirm malignancy/histology prior to catheter placement; separately reportable as distinct diagnostic procedure.

notes: CPT 31643 is the primary code for bronchoscopy with brachytherapy catheter placement.
The radiation oncology service bills separately for treatment planning (77316-77318) and HDR delivery (77785-77787).
The pulmonologist/interventionalist bills only for the catheter placement procedure.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Codes align with documented endobronchial brachytherapy catheter placement procedure. CPT 31643 covers bronchoscopic catheter insertion for radioelement application. Additional biopsy code 31625 supported by documentation.

radiation_oncology_codes.treatment_planning: 77316-77318 (brachytherapy isodose plan - billed by radiation oncology)
radiation_oncology_codes.hdr_delivery: 77785-77787 (HDR brachytherapy delivery - billed by radiation oncology)

billing_notes.coding_guidance: Per CMS LCD L30320: The pulmonologist should not report brachytherapy treatment codes. Only the catheter placement (31643) is reported by the bronchoscopist. The radioelement and treatment delivery are billed separately by radiation oncology.

changes: Generated synthetic brachytherapy procedure note with complete registry data

note_text:
Pt: Williams, Thomas || MRN: 875678 || DOB: 11/21/1953
Date: 11/29/2025 || Location: Cleveland Clinic, Cleveland, OH
MD: Dr. Chen

DIAGNOSIS: Adenoid cystic carcinoma of the trachea with slow growth over 3 years
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopy with placement of brachytherapy catheter (HDR Session 1/4)
PRIOR THERAPY: Prior EBRT 55 Gy completed 2 years ago

INDICATION: 72 y/o male with Adenoid cystic carcinoma presenting with progressive dyspnea, inspiratory stridor. Endobronchial lesion at Mid-trachea with approximately 45% obstruction. Tumor length estimated at 1.6 cm. Patient evaluated by radiation oncology and deemed candidate for HDR endobronchial brachytherapy for local control.

SEDATION: Moderate sedation
AIRWAY: Native

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Transnasal flexible bronchoscopy performed. Airway inspection revealed endobronchial tumor at Mid-trachea with partial luminal obstruction. Tumor appears exophytic with moderate surface ulceration.

CATHETER PLACEMENT:
A 5F flexible catheter was introduced through the bronchoscope working channel. The catheter was advanced past the distal margin of the lesion to a position approximately 2 cm beyond the tumor. Catheter position verified under fluoroscopy. The catheter was marked at the nostril and secured with tape. Dummy source positioning performed. Treatment length: 3.6 cm (tumor + 1 cm margins).

TREATMENT PLAN:
HDR brachytherapy planned: 6.0 Gy x 4 fractions prescribed at 1.0 cm from catheter center.
Fractionation schedule: weekly intervals.
Session 1 of 4 to be delivered today.

COMPLICATIONS: None. No bleeding. No catheter dislodgment.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient transported to Radiation Oncology for treatment delivery. Catheter to remain in place if next session within 24h. CXR obtained - no pneumothorax.

PLAN: 
- Return for session 2/4 in weekly
- Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks to assess response
- Continue symptom management
- Contact clinic for acute dyspnea, hemoptysis, or fever

C. Chen MD
